intro: Hiptage benghalensis subsp. candicans, commonly known as the Bengal hiptage, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
